content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looks great!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good challenge, it is well explained and should be fun and interesting to play.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It looks good, and is a neat challenge for other coders. Clear descriptions!

Happy Coding!

Hey, here’s another clash idea for you… 

Do another clash that checks if it’s symmetrical from top left to bottom right and/or from top right to bottom left

Binary output issue
* Binary output should be avoided in clashes as per contribution guidelines. There are only two possible answers (symmetric / not symmatric), and there should be more than two in total to fix the binary output issue.

Goal
* Note 2 need not be mentioned. It is the basic assumption behind every clash.

Thanks.

To avoid the binary problem:

Maybe you could have it so that it checks if its symmetrical left to right and also checks if it’s symmetrical top to bottom

Well, let's wait for this one to be approved first :)

But yes, that might be a nice idea, provided that I can find and/or paint some nice and diagonally symmetric ASCII art. It's a bit tricky, since the used characters have to be diagonally symmetric themselves, or the picture will not look symmetric. Basically, you are left with X,O,# and * to draw with, even slashes look quite asymmetric.

Thanks for the hint. I'll adapt the statement accordingly. My original version differentiated between the two types of symmetry, but then I simplified it. I guess I'll have to read the guidelines more carefully. :)
That was a good idea. I also added another test case for vertical symmetry.

Thank you Lisa for your idea and Klimpergeist for the changes.

Output
* Please format the output phrases as {{constants}} instead of in <<bold>>.

Constraints
* Suggest to mention that there won't be any case which exhibits both types of symmetry (after you've checked that's indeed the case).

Thanks again.
